etymology.description: 艹(艹) (cǎo, "grass") + 余(余) (yú) = plant component and phonetic -> tea
etymology.interpretation: The character 茶(chá) combines 艹(艹) (cǎo, "grass") implying a plant, with 余(余) (yú) for its phonetic aspect. Originally derived from a modification of 荼, which meant "bitter plant" in classical texts, 茶(chá) specifically came to signify "tea." This combines the concept of a plant with a sound similar to the word for tea.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢喝茶(我喜歡喝茶)。
早上喝茶(早上喝茶)，心情变好(心情變好)。
examples.pinyin: Zǎoshang hē chá, xīnqíng biàn hǎo.
examples.english: Drinking tea in the morning improves the mood.
